However, if you're open to films slightly outside that year, "Keeping the Faith" (2000) is another great option with a unique plot about two friends, a priest and a rabbi, who both fall in love with the same woman. Ben Stiller and Edward Norton star in this heartwarming comedy-drama. Enjoy the movies!

*In Happy Gilmore*, Adam Sandler plays an unconventional hockey player turned golfer who is trying to save his grandmother's house, adding a touch of humor to the story.

This thought-provoking romance features Keira Knightley, Carey Mulligan, and Andrew Garfield in a poignant tale set against the backdrop of post-war Moscow.

On the other hand, if you're keen on a more contemporary setting, "You've Got Mail" with Meg Ryan and Tom Hanks might be just the ticket. It's a delightful story about two business rivals who fall in love online, unaware that they're each other's anonymous pen pals! Enjoy your movie time!
